description.narrative:
1. Middle/operational management of (medium-sized) domestically-owned companies active in: a) Breeding & hatching (breeder farms, hatcheries). b) Farming (broiler farms, layer farms). c) Feed production (ingredients storage, premixes/concentrates, complete/compound feed). d) Processing facilities (transport, slaughterhouses, further processing facilities, waste water treatment).
2. Potential Bangladeshi entrepreneurs and investors active in/considering to enter the poultry sector: a) Related projects and support services. b) Local financial institutions.
3. Government and ministries
4. Poultry related associations
5. Knowledge Institutes
6. Local sector experts
7. Bangladeshi consumers of poultry meat and eggs

Four studies are conducted by the impact cluster partners. These include: Study 1. M&E: Baseline study and CSR risks assessment & final evaluation (endline study). Study 2. Identification and assessments of demonstration partners and locations. Study 3. Calculations of business cases & layout designs of demonstration facilities. Study 4. Legal support studies.

Study 1.  Monitoring and assessment of impact of the cluster activities.  Assessment of the impact of COVID-19 on the Bangladeshi poultry sector.  Provide tools to the impact cluster partners to plan project activities. Study 2.  Thorough assessment of possible partners and suitable locations to establish the demonstrations. Study 3.  Development of business cases that prove efficiency, profitability and sustainability of the envisioned demonstration facilities. Study 4.  Legal assessments for participating Consortium members with regards to import & distribution and investment into Bangladesh.
